snippet: Mr. Howard’s case has focused attention on the workings of Manhattan drug court, which offers treatment instead of prison to nonviolent addicts who deal drugs to support their habit.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Judge Patricia Nunez sentences Tyrone Howard to 12 years in prison for violating plea agreement in which he was released into drug treatment program; defends her decision against criticisms from New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and Police Commissioner William J Bratton, who have blamed Howard's release for murder of New York City Police Officer Randolph Holder, of which Howard is accused.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Howard’s case has focused attention on the workings of Manhattan drug court, which offers treatment instead of prison to nonviolent addicts who deal drugs to support their habit.

headline.main: Tyrone Howard, Man Charged With Killing Officer, Gets Maximum Term in Drug Case
headline.print_headline: Defendant in Police Killing Gets 12 Years in Drug Case
